Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so that when it goes to add them back in, it only has txs that were not in the block

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this should also make the list a heap smaller speeding up processing

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or maybe have a savemempool that is a snapshot of the mempool before any of this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then restore just those tx to get back to the original mempool

Content: thats what it does

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: i'll play around with it... I keep forking test chains

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: there will be a solution

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: agreed

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
it can 
remove any txs that are added to the mempool from the tempmempool

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this will reduce the size ofd the temp mempool. and also stop it trying to add huge amoutns of invlid txs

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: also doesnt seem to need a temp mempool. a List works just fine too.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I wasnt able to change it to a tx list rather than a mempool, because the tx differed slightly and didnt allow it to be removed. But this does not matter, because not its not doing mempool checks multiple times anymore, so has removed all those addtowallet and accepttomempool prints.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: In the rare case there is an invalid tx in a nodes mempool, it wil just stay in that nodes mempool as would normally happen.  Other nodes wont accept it.
